column5: Hey.. just a quick plug, for my newest adventure:  MNR Watch. Ive noticed that there is no real place where we can see whats going on with the MNR province wide so here ya go:   For many years now Ontario’s Ministry of Natural Resources (MNR) staff have had to learn how to continue to effectively manage our Fish and Wildlife resources with less revenue. Amazingly they are still doing an incredible job. MNR Watch is a compilation of MNR related news items and MNR’s activities across the province. The majority of items highlight MNR’s remarkable work, often in small local media outlets that otherwise most Ontarians would not see. MNR WATCH is not associated or endorsed in any way with the ministry itself. Users may use MNR Watch to see what the MNR is up to across the province. This website will also help detail how massive MNR service cuts are affecting the protection of Ontario’s wildlife, tourism, and resources.  Come on over and sign up for email updates or like us on facebook to get the news in your facebook feed!  http://mnrwatch.com/
Right on TJ!  I got this book marked.  Thanks!  Cheers, Ron...

T'ank-you kindly . . . .   they changed the location of this when I wasn't lookin,' I'd had it bookmarked under 'BUSTED' for years, then I couldn't find the new location. It's VERY useful to see just what's going on out there!
i have been looking to see what happens to people in mnr court but can't find a site that lists the charges and outcomes, does this site give me that?
Subscribed to the mailing list...very cool idea
Good for the MNR for changing with the times.
